snippet: The findings may help explain the role habitual behavior plays in disorders where people persist in making self-destructive choices no matter the consequences.
abstract: Study published in journal Nature Neuroscience finds that habit plays bigger role in anorexia than previously thought, which helps explain why eating disorder is so difficult to treat.
lead_paragraph: The findings may help explain the role habitual behavior plays in disorders where people persist in making self-destructive choices no matter the consequences.

headline.main: Anorexia May Be Habit, Not Willpower, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: Anorexia May Be Habit, Not Resolve, Study Finds
